item.title: R to @Mappletons: Funny how being a reader of this blog became a type of person as well. One of my current friend groups is still best described as ‚Äúpeople who have read a lot of Ribbonfarm‚Äù
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description: Funny how being a reader of this blog became a type of person as well. One of my current friend groups is still best described as ‚Äúpeople who have read a lot of Ribbonfarm‚Äù

item.title: All good things must come to an end, but still sad. Started reading Ribbonfarm in high school (~2008)! Had no a clue what half of it was saying. Exposed me to a kind a chaotic, intellectually-intense writing style I didn‚Äôt know you were allowed to do. Leaving a hole in the blogosphere few others can fill‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
All good things must come to an end, but still sad.
Started reading Ribbonfarm in high school (~2008)! Had no a clue what half of it was saying.
Exposed me to a kind a chaotic, intellectually-intense writing style I didn‚Äôt know you were allowed to do.
Leaving a hole in the blogosphere few others can fill‚Ä¶

item.title:
9am me: Time to sit down and work through that 2 hour vector DB tutorial
5 mins later me: Wow my terminal just isn‚Äôt aesthetically pleasing enough for this. Must spend the next hour installing Hyper, Oh My Zsh, Spaceship, picking themes, browsing fonts, and installing plugins‚Ä¶

item.title:
NotebookLM's generated podcast is pretty good! But the generically American, over-scripted voices are grating to listen to. It's NPR-ish acting/phrasing is cringe.
We need snarky British mode. When we getting David Attenborough chatting to Maggie Smith as the default?
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
NotebookLM's generated podcast is pretty good! But the generically American, over-scripted voices are grating to listen to. It's NPR-ish acting/phrasing is cringe.

We need snarky British mode. When we getting David Attenborough chatting to Maggie Smith as the default?

item.description: Expecting a rise in the number of babies named Claude.

item.title:
Weird affectation of being temporarily deaf is I keep reaching up to take my airpods out of my ears, only to realise they're not in there.
Apple has somehow conditioned me to walk around London semi-deaf as a normal state of affairs...
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Weird affectation of being temporarily deaf is I keep reaching up to take my airpods out of my ears, only to realise they're not in there.

Apple has somehow conditioned me to walk around London semi-deaf as a normal state of affairs...

nitter.privacydev.net/Mappletons/status/1839355910596300869#m

item.title:
R to @Mappletons: Feels like something we could expose more people to (without the painful infection bit).
In school we had days where we wore a blindfold to understand how blind people navigate and cope. And 48 hour fasts to understand what extreme hunger feels like. Hearing loss would be easy to mimic in the same way.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Feels like something we could expose more people to (without the painful infection bit).

In school we had days where we wore a blindfold to understand how blind people navigate and cope. And 48 hour fasts to understand what extreme hunger feels like. Hearing loss would be easy to mimic in the same way.

item.title:
Been partially deaf this week thanks to severe ear infection in both ears. Awful, painful, but useful experience.
YouTube or Twitter video doesn‚Äôt have accurate captions? No idea what‚Äôs going on. Can‚Äôt watch it.
Can‚Äôt do zoom calls. Would need live subtitles.
Can‚Äôt use background noise (footsteps, cars, voices) to figure out what or who is happening around me.
Stranger says something to me in a shop. Haven‚Äôt a clue. Politely smile and hope that suffices.
Fascinating and helpful to lose a sense for a while.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

YouTube or Twitter video doesn‚Äôt have accurate captions? No idea what‚Äôs going on. Can‚Äôt watch it.

Can‚Äôt do zoom calls. Would need live subtitles.

Can‚Äôt use background noise (footsteps, cars, voices) to figure out what or who is happening around me.

Stranger says something to me in a shop. Haven‚Äôt a clue. Politely smile and hope that suffices.

Fascinating and helpful to lose a sense for a while.

item.title:
RT by @Mappletons: Dynamicland's new website, documenting ten years of work, will be released tomorrow at http://dynamicland.org.
In the meantime, this video about Dynamicland's precursor gives some backstory and motivations. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uI7J3II59lc
item.dc:creator: @worrydream

item.title:
Who do I know in London building original AI products?
Apart from @meetgranola, @NustomSoftware, @tldraw, @humanloop
As in, the company is founded and based in London. Feels like this list should be longer.
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons

item.title:
Nobody will remember: - your salary - how ‚Äúbusy‚Äù you were - how many hours you worked
People will remember: - how many hot AI takes you had - which hot AI takes got you premium likes - if you forced others to have hot AI takes
item.dc:creator: @Mappletons
item.description:
Nobody will remember:
- your salary
- how ‚Äúbusy‚Äù you were
- how many hours you worked

People will remember:
- how many hot AI takes you had
- which hot AI takes got you premium likes
- if you forced others to have hot AI takes
